page.title: 04GIRSBY TOP
page.content: This farm lies between the old Girsby Manor and the River Bain, being approx _imately 300 acres, comprising 100 acres each of woodland, permanent pasture & arable. Crops _ wheat, peas, barley & oil seed rape. A single suck_ ler Beef herd is kept of 50 calving cows. The calves run with mothers and are weaned at 5 months, fattened at 18 months and sold.At time of this report (Nov) calves are in yard fattening and cows due to calf again in February. 2 Bulls used, one a Lincoln Red & the other a Limousin. Woodland is ongoing task with thinning,replanting,felling and has a variety of trees _ Oak, Ash, Beech, Sycamore and a few Elm which have survived Dutch Elm disease. Also Scots & Corsican Pine, Larch & Spruce and a few more exotic specimens _ Monkey Trees and Cupressus.
